channel.title: personal on Rich In SQL
channel.description: Recent content in personal on Rich In SQL

item.title: Using Chocolatey
item.author: hello@richinsql.com (Rich)
item.description: One of the most time consuming tasks when configuring a new computer is installing all of the applications that I use on a day to day basis, I am sure that everyone has this very same problem, but recently I came accross a package manager for Windows called Chocolatey, I am sure this has been around for absoloutely ages, looking at the amount of packages that are available but for me it is still pretty new.

item.title: Rebuilding My Workstation
item.author: hello@richinsql.com (Rich)
item.description: This year has been incredibly strange to try and bring back some kind of normality I decided to rebuild my home workstation, this post will serve as the log for that project. What I had before Before I started this project I was making use of a refurbished Dell Optiplex 7020 with an i7 2600 processor, 16GB of 2400 ram, a SSD for the main operating system disk and a 1TB Western Digital which we would later re-purpose.

item.title: My Current 2019 Setup
item.author: hello@richinsql.com (Rich)
item.description: I have never done a my setup post here before, I donâ€™t think it ever occurred to me that it might be something that people would be interested in, however my home workstation is now in a place that I am happy to share. It is not by any stretch perfect, and there are some things that I would like to change but here it is, as of July 2019.
